title: Alaric II, eighth king of the Visigoths promulgates the Breviary of Alaric (Breviarium Alaricianum or Lex Romana Visigothorum), a collection of "Roman law".
text: Alaric II, eighth king of the Visigoths promulgates the Breviary of Alaric (Breviarium Alaricianum or Lex Romana Visigothorum), a collection of "Roman law".

title: Battle of Lüneburg Heath: King Louis III is defeated by the Norse Great Heathen Army at Lüneburg Heath in Saxony.
text: Battle of Lüneburg Heath: King Louis III is defeated by the Norse Great Heathen Army at Lüneburg Heath in Saxony.

title: Translatio imperii: Pope John XII crowns Otto I, Holy Roman Emperor, the first Holy Roman Emperor in nearly 40 years.
text: Translatio imperii: Pope John XII crowns Otto I, Holy Roman Emperor, the first Holy Roman Emperor in nearly 40 years.

title: Conrad II, Holy Roman Emperor becomes king of Burgundy.
text: Conrad II, Holy Roman Emperor becomes king of Burgundy.

title: The Battle of Lincoln, at which Stephen, King of England is defeated and captured by the allies of Empress Matilda.
text: The Battle of Lincoln, at which Stephen, King of England is defeated and captured by the allies of Empress Matilda.

title: Terra Mariana, eventually comprising present-day Latvia and Estonia, is established.
text: Terra Mariana, eventually comprising present-day Latvia and Estonia, is established.

title: Nine leaders of the Transylvanian peasant revolt are executed at Torda.
text: Nine leaders of the Transylvanian peasant revolt are executed at Torda.

title: Wars of the Roses: The Battle of Mortimer's Cross is fought in Herefordshire, England.
text: Wars of the Roses: The Battle of Mortimer's Cross is fought in Herefordshire, England.

title: Spaniard Pedro de Mendoza founds Buenos Aires, Argentina.
text: Spaniard Pedro de Mendoza founds Buenos Aires, Argentina.

title: Battle of Inverlochy.[1]
text: Battle of Inverlochy.[1]

title: New Amsterdam (later renamed The City of New York) is incorporated.
text: New Amsterdam (later renamed The City of New York) is incorporated.

title: Alexander Selkirk is rescued after being shipwrecked on a desert island, inspiring Daniel Defoe's adventure book Robinson Crusoe.
text: Alexander Selkirk is rescued after being shipwrecked on a desert island, inspiring Daniel Defoe's adventure book Robinson Crusoe.

title: Mexican–American War: The Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo is signed.
text: Mexican–American War: The Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo is signed.

title: Brigham Young declares war on Timpanogos in the Battle at Fort Utah.
text: Brigham Young declares war on Timpanogos in the Battle at Fort Utah.

title: Pro-Imperial forces captured Osaka Castle from the Tokugawa shogunate and burned it to the ground.
text: Pro-Imperial forces captured Osaka Castle from the Tokugawa shogunate and burned it to the ground.

title: The National League of Professional Baseball Clubs of Major League Baseball is formed.
text: The National League of Professional Baseball Clubs of Major League Baseball is formed.

title: In Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania the first Groundhog Day is observed.
text: In Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania the first Groundhog Day is observed.

title: The Australian Premiers' Conference held in Melbourne decides to locate Australia's capital city, Canberra, between Sydney and Melbourne.
text: The Australian Premiers' Conference held in Melbourne decides to locate Australia's capital city, Canberra, between Sydney and Melbourne.

title: Funeral of Queen Victoria.
text: Funeral of Queen Victoria.

title: Grand Central Terminal is opened in New York City.
text: Grand Central Terminal is opened in New York City.

title: The Tartu Peace Treaty is signed between Estonia and Russia.
text: The Tartu Peace Treaty is signed between Estonia and Russia.

title: France occupies Memel.
text: France occupies Memel.

title: Ulysses by James Joyce is published.
text: Ulysses by James Joyce is published.

title: Serum run to Nome: Dog sleds reach Nome, Alaska with diphtheria serum, inspiring the Iditarod race.
text: Serum run to Nome: Dog sleds reach Nome, Alaska with diphtheria serum, inspiring the Iditarod race.

title: The Export-Import Bank of the United States is incorporated.
text: The Export-Import Bank of the United States is incorporated.

title: Leonarde Keeler administers polygraph tests to two murder suspects, the first time polygraph evidence was admitted in U.S. courts.
text: Leonarde Keeler administers polygraph tests to two murder suspects, the first time polygraph evidence was admitted in U.S. courts.

title: The Osvald Group is responsible for the first, active event of anti-Nazi resistance in Norway, to protest the inauguration of Vidkun Quisling.
text: The Osvald Group is responsible for the first, active event of anti-Nazi resistance in Norway, to protest the inauguration of Vidkun Quisling.

title: World War II: The Battle of Stalingrad comes to an end when Soviet troops accept the surrender of the last German troops in the city.
text: World War II: The Battle of Stalingrad comes to an end when Soviet troops accept the surrender of the last German troops in the city.

title: Nine experienced ski hikers in the northern Ural Mountains in the Soviet Union die under mysterious circumstances.
text: Nine experienced ski hikers in the northern Ural Mountains in the Soviet Union die under mysterious circumstances.

title: Pakistan suggests a six-point agenda with Kashmir after the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965.
text: Pakistan suggests a six-point agenda with Kashmir after the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965.

title: Idi Amin replaces President Milton Obote as leader of Uganda.
text: Idi Amin replaces President Milton Obote as leader of Uganda.

title: The international Ramsar Convention for the conservation and sustainable utilization of wetlands is signed in Ramsar, Mazandaran, Iran.
text: The international Ramsar Convention for the conservation and sustainable utilization of wetlands is signed in Ramsar, Mazandaran, Iran.

title: Reports surface that the FBI is targeting allegedly corrupt Congressmen in the Abscam operation.
text: Reports surface that the FBI is targeting allegedly corrupt Congressmen in the Abscam operation.

title: Hama massacre: The government of Syria attacks the town of Hama.
text: Hama massacre: The government of Syria attacks the town of Hama.

title: After the 1986 People Power Revolution, the Philippines enacts a new constitution.
text: After the 1986 People Power Revolution, the Philippines enacts a new constitution.

title: Soviet–Afghan War: The last Soviet armoured column leaves Kabul.
text: Soviet–Afghan War: The last Soviet armoured column leaves Kabul.

title: Apartheid: F. W. de Klerk announces the unbanning of the African National Congress and promises to release Nelson Mandela.
text: Apartheid: F. W. de Klerk announces the unbanning of the African National Congress and promises to release Nelson Mandela.

title: First digital cinema projection in Europe (Paris) realized by Philippe Binant with the DLP CINEMA technology developed by Texas Instruments.
text: First digital cinema projection in Europe (Paris) realized by Philippe Binant with the DLP CINEMA technology developed by Texas Instruments.

title: Swiss tennis player Roger Federer becomes the No. 1 ranked men's singles player, a position he will hold for a record 237 weeks.
text: Swiss tennis player Roger Federer becomes the No. 1 ranked men's singles player, a position he will hold for a record 237 weeks.

title: The Government of Canada introduces the Civil Marriage Act. This legislation would become law on July 20, 2005, legalizing same-sex marriage.
text: The Government of Canada introduces the Civil Marriage Act. This legislation would become law on July 20, 2005, legalizing same-sex marriage.

title: Police officer Filippo Raciti is killed when a clash breaks out in the Sicily derby between Catania and Palermo, in the Serie A, the top flight of Italian football. This event led to major changes in stadium regulations in Italy.
